predictions.text: CNN Fear & Greed Index will register at or above 75 (Greed/Extreme Greed) on at least one day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A daily reading >= 75 appears on CNN’s Fear & Greed Index page by 2025-11-30 (UTC). Archive or screenshot acceptable.
monitoring_signals: Positive earnings revisions for mega-cap tech
predictions.rationale: Risk appetite is elevated amid a strong equity rally and robust profits, pushing sentiment toward greed.

predictions.text: U.S. Advance Retail Sales Control Group (MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Census Bureau’s “Advance Monthly Sales for Retail and Food Services” release shows the control group (retail sales excluding autos, gas, building materials, and food services) MoM SA in [-0.2%, +0.2%].
monitoring_signals: Tariff pass-through to prices and demand
Gasoline prices impacting real retail control
predictions.rationale: Tariff-related pressures and mixed consumer tailwinds point to a flat control-group print.

predictions.text: U.S. Producer Price Index (headline, MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between -0.1% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS PPI Final Demand (seasonally adjusted, MoM) for Oct 2025 is within [-0.1%, +0.3%] in the official release.
monitoring_signals: Energy price changes feeding into PPI (refined products)
predictions.rationale: Goods disinflation offset by steady services suggests a modest headline PPI outcome.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10Y–2Y Treasury yield spread (FRED: T10Y2Y) will reach at or above -0.10 percentage points on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series T10Y2Y shows a daily close >= -0.10 on any date through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Term premium estimates and Treasury supply
Risk-on equity tone aiding long-end demand
predictions.rationale: A risk-on rally and benign inflation could drive incremental steepening toward un-inversion.

predictions.text: Freddie Mac PMMS 30-year fixed mortgage rate will print at or below 7.00% in at least one weekly survey by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Freddie Mac PMMS weekly U.S. 30-year fixed mortgage rate is <= 7.00% in an official release before or on 2025-11-30.
predictions.rationale: Falling long-end yields and stable MBS spreads could pull mortgage rates to 7%.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, OPEC+ will formally announce a December 2025 crude supply increase between 0.2 and 0.6 million bpd versus November levels.
predictions.verification_criteria: Official OPEC/OPEC+ communiqué or press release specifies an aggregate December increase of 0.2–0.6 mb/d from November.
monitoring_signals: Leaked quota discussions via energy media
OECD inventory trends and time spreads
predictions.rationale: Signals point to a modest December boost followed by a Q1 pause to manage balances.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI crude oil front-month futures (CL) will settle at or above $86.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CME Group official settlement for the front-month WTI (CL) contract is >= $86.00 on any trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.rationale: Potential supply discipline and geopolitics support a test of the high-$80s.

predictions.text: KRX KOSPI Index (^KS11) will close at or above 2,550.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official Korea Exchange close for the KOSPI index is >= 2,550.0 on any trading day by 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Foreign net equity flows into Korea
predictions.rationale: Regional risk appetite and chip-cycle optimism can lift Korea’s benchmark.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, China’s MOFCOM will publish an official notice easing at least one rare-earth export restriction introduced in 2024–2025.
predictions.verification_criteria: An official MOFCOM announcement/notice reduces or removes a rare-earth export control (e.g., licensing/catalogue restriction) added in 2024–2025; publication date on or before 2025-11-30.
predictions.rationale: Reporting indicates a tactical rollback to ease supply-chain strains and reduce tensions.

predictions.text: University of Michigan 5-year inflation expectations (preliminary) for November 2025 will print between 2.8% and 3.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: UMich Surveys of Consumers preliminary November release shows the 5-year inflation expectations measure in [2.8%, 3.2%].
monitoring_signals: Labor market headlines and layoff announcements
Tariff and food price news flow
predictions.rationale: Long-run expectations have been range-bound, with mixed price signals likely keeping them near 3%.
